projects.name: Finance calculator
projects.intro: Loan finance calculator for Mayden Academy
projects.brief: Create a finance calculator to be used on the Mayden Academy website. This should allow prospective students to calculate the time taken to repay their loan, as well as any applicable admin fees. Must be built using TypeScript and a CSS preprocessor.
projects.execution: I had fun with this one - matching the MA branding, building in dependent fields and validation, and calculating the loan details.

projects.name: Thump a Trump
projects.brief: Create a JavaScript game in the style of whack-a-mole.
projects.execution: The first team project, we managed to over-deliver during the sprint and created a great-looking and addictive game - just in time for the 2020 US election!

projects.name: Beers collection
projects.brief: Create a collection app using PHP and MySQL, enabling the display of all database items as well as the addition of new ones.
projects.execution: The first project involving MySQL, the beers collection was built in PHP and HTML, using POST requests to capture user data.

projects.name: Blackjack
projects.brief: Create a basic blackjack game using PHP
projects.execution: I expanded on the brief a bit, adding card images, twist/stick, and multi-player features.

projects.name: Checkmark
projects.intro: Decision quality assurance system for the Planning Inspectorate
projects.brief: The aim was to unify all quality assurance functions across the Planning Inspectorate, increasing the scope of data captured, reducing admin overhead and the likelihood of data errors, whilst providing users with a self-service system.
projects.execution: Three apps were built using Microsoft Power Apps, supported by 6 SharePoint lists/libraries and 19 Power Automate flows. The final solution had saved over 500 weeks from overall case age as of the end of the pilot phase alone.
